posts.content:
Aqua: Muhstik Malware Targets Message Queuing Services Applications
Aqua Nautilus discovered a new campaign of Muhstik malware targeting message queuing services applications such as Apache RocketMQ. The attackers downloaded Muhstik onto the compromised instances by exploiting CVE-2023-33246 (9.8 critical, disclosed 23 May 2023 by Apache, added to KEV Catalog 06 September 2023. Apache RocketMQ Command Execution Vulnerability). Aqua describes the vulnerability exploitation, attacker actions on objective, and provide IOC.

#threatintel #IOC #Muhstik #CVE_2023_33246

CVE-2023-33246.description:
For RocketMQ versions 5.1.0 and below, under certain conditions, there is a risk of remote command execution. 

Several components of RocketMQ, including NameServer, Broker, and Controller, are leaked on the extranet and lack permission verification, an attacker can exploit this vulnerability by using the update configuration function to execute commands as the system users that RocketMQ is running as. Additionally, an attacker can achieve the same effect by forging the RocketMQ protocol content. 

To prevent these attacks, users are recommended to upgrade to version 5.1.1 or above for using RocketMQ 5.x or 4.9.6 or above for using RocketMQ 4.x .

posts.content:
Symantec: RansomHub: New Ransomware has Origins in Older Knight
Symantec assesses that RansomHub Ransomware-as-a-Service (RaaS) is very likely an updated and rebranded version of the older Knight ransomware. Analysis of the RansomHub payload by Symantec revealed a high degree of similarity between the two threats. RansomHub attackers gain initial access by exploiting the Zerologon vulnerability CVE-2020-1472 (10.0 Critical, disclosed 17 August 2020, added to KEV Catalog 03 November 2021) IOC provided.

#zerologon #threatintel #IOC #ransomhub #Knightransomware #ransomware

CVE-2020-1472.description: An elevation of privilege vulnerability exists when an attacker establishes a vulnerable Netlogon secure channel connection to a domain controller, using the Netlogon Remote Protocol (MS-NRPC), aka 'Netlogon Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability'.

posts.content:
Pozwólcie, że coś wyjaśnię, bo nie pierwszy już raz widzę takie kwiatki w serwisie dobreprogramy. Autor omawia majowe aktualizacje Microsoftu i narzeka na "CVSS z Księżyca" i rzekomą inflację w procesie szacowania skali zagrożenia. Chodzi m.in. o lukę CVE-2024-30040 w MSHTML, czyli w silniku Internet Explorera (mimo że sama przeglądarka z systemu została usunięta, to jej silnik nadal jest używany do renderowania zawartości webowej w dokumentach Office). W skali CVSS przyznano jej 8,8 pkt. - zdaniem autora o wiele za dużo, bo efektywne wykorzystanie luki wymaga od użytkownika samodzielnego pobrania i otwarcia złośliwego pliku, więc pff! gdzie tu wielkie zagrożenie? Szkopuł w tym, że właśnie ta luka jest już aktywnie używana w atakach - ktoś się nabiera, pobiera, otwiera i dochodzi do infekcji, czyli warto tę lukę w trybie pilnym załatać. Wypadałoby przed rozpoczęciem narzekania doczytać sobie to i owo.

#infosec #cyberbezpieczenstwo #microsoft

CVE-2024-30040.description: Windows MSHTML Platform Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability

CVE-2017-3506.description: Vulnerability in the Oracle WebLogic Server component of Oracle Fusion Middleware (subcomponent: Web Services). Supported versions that are affected are 10.3.6.0, 12.1.3.0, 12.2.1.0, 12.2.1.1 and 12.2.1.2. Difficult to exploit vulnerability allows unauthenticated attacker with network access via HTTP to compromise Oracle WebLogic Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized creation, deletion or modification access to critical data or all Oracle WebLogic Server accessible data as well as unauthorized access to critical data or complete access to all Oracle WebLogic Server accessible data. CVSS 3.0 Base Score 7.4 (Confidentiality and Integrity impacts). CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:H/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:N).

posts.content:
To all those security people out there thinking that you can't be a "real" security engineer without a #CVE (and preferably lots of them). I want to share the *first* CVE that I actually have in almost 20 years of work!

Why so long? Almost nothing I fixed was publicly visible or semi-coordinated embargoes made a CVE impractical.

Don't let people gatekeep you with stupid stuff.

CVE-2024-36121

(No, it isn't practically exploitable. Nothing to worry about.)
https://github.com/netty/netty-incubator-codec-ohttp/security/advisories/GHSA-g762-h86w-8749

CVE-2024-36121.description:
### Summary
BoringSSLAEADContext keeps track of how many OHTTP responses have been sent and uses this sequence number to calculate the appropriate nonce to use with the encryption algorithm. 
Unfortunately, two separate errors combine which would allow an attacker to cause the sequence number to overflow and thus the nonce to repeat.

### Details
1. There is no overflow detection or enforcement of the maximum sequence value. (This is a missed requirement from the draft Chunked Oblivious OHTTP RFC and so should be inherited from the HPKE RFC 9180, Section 5.2).
2. The sequence number (seq) is stored as 32-bit int which is relatively easy to overflow.

https://github.com/netty/netty-incubator-codec-ohttp/blob/1ddadb6473cd3be5491d114431ed4c1a9f316001/codec-ohttp-hpke-classes-boringssl/src/main/java/io/netty/incubator/codec/hpke/boringssl/BoringSSLAEADContext.java#L112-L114

### Impact
If the BoringSSLAEADContext is used to encrypt more than 2^32 messages then the AES-GCM nonce will repeat.
Repeating a nonce with AES-GCM results in both confidentiality and integrity compromise of data encrypted with the associated key.

posts.content:
Horizon3: CVE-2023-48788: Revisiting Fortinet FortiClient EMS to Exploit 7.2.X
Horizon3 concluded that their exploit from the previous deep-dive on CVE-2023-48788 (9.8 critical, disclosed 22 February 2024 by Fortinet, with proof of concept by Horizon3) only affected FortiClient EMS 7.0.x versions. They discuss the differences in exploitation between FortiClient EMS's two mainline versions: 7.0.x and 7.2.x. Horizon3 also includes insights into the issues surrounding the exploit development for CVE-2023-48788 to determine success.

#CVE_2023_48788 #Fortinet #vulnerability #CVE #proofofconcept #POC #FortiClient

CVE-2023-48788.description: A improper neutralization of special elements used in an sql command ('sql injection') in Fortinet FortiClientEMS version 7.2.0 through 7.2.2, FortiClientEMS 7.0.1 through 7.0.10 allows attacker to execute unauthorized code or commands via specially crafted packets.

posts.content:
Outpost24: Five new vulnerabilities found in Zyxel NAS devices (including code execution and privilege escalation)
Outpost24 provided vulnerability details and proofs of concept for five Zyxel NAS vulnerabilities:

  • CVE-2024-29972 (9.8 critical) command injection vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-29973 (9.8 critical) command injection vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-29974 (9.8 critical) remote code execution vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-29975 (6.7 medium) improper privilege management vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-29976 (6.5 medium) improper privilege management vulnerability

Zyxel has treated the disclosure process fairly, agreeing to a coordinated disclosure. Despite the fact that the device has reached End-of-Life by the end of last year, they still released patches for the three critical vulnerabilities CVE-2024-29972, CVE-2024-29973, and CVE-2024-29974. Furthermore, as the device has reached End-of-Life, they decided to remove the "Remote Support" account "NsaRescueAngel".

h/t: @BleepingComputer Zyxel issues emergency RCE patch for end-of-life NAS devices

#CVE #Zyxel #vulnerability #proofofconcept

CVE-2024-29976.description:
** UNSUPPORTED WHEN ASSIGNED **
The improper privilege management vulnerability in the command “show_allsessions” in Zyxel NAS326 firmware versions before V5.21(AAZF.17)C0 and NAS542 firmware versions before V5.21(ABAG.14)C0 could allow an authenticated attacker to obtain a logged-in administrator’s session information containing cookies on an affected device.

  • CVE-2024-5493 (high) Chromium: CVE-2024-5493 Heap buffer overflow in WebRTC

  • CVE-2024-5496 (high) Chromium: CVE-2024-5496 Use after free in Media Session
  • CVE-2024-5497 (high) Chromium: CVE-2024-5497 Out of bounds memory access in Keyboard Inputs
  • CVE-2024-5498 (high) Chromium: CVE-2024-5498 Use after free in Presentation API
  • CVE-2024-5499 (high) Chromium: CVE-2024-5499 Out of bounds write in Streams API

These CVEs were disclosed Thursday 30 May 2024 by Google (see parent toot above). Today's updates were minimally documented in Release notes for Microsoft Edge Security Updates
